content: God Confronts JobHave You Gotten to the Bottom of Things?
And now, finally,  answered Job from the eye of a violent storm. He said:
I have some questions for you,
Where were you when I created the earth?
Who decided on its size? Certainly you’ll know that!
While the morning stars sang in chorus
And who took charge of the ocean
That was me! I wrapped it in soft clouds,
Then I made a playpen for it,
And said, ‘Stay here, this is your place.
What Do You Have to Say for Yourself?
“Who do you think gave weather-wisdom to the ibis,
Does anyone know enough to number all the clouds
When the earth is cracked and dry,
